name: East African Spade-snouted Gecko
description: A small gecko with a large head and a thick, bluntly tipped tail. It is colored in various shades of brown and beige.
image_alt: East African spade-snouted gecko, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Length up to 10 cm, tail max. 50% of total length
reproduction: Females lay 2 eggs with flexible shells.
attractions: Rarely encountered in captivity due to its specialized diet. It is a terrestrial species that hides during the day and hunts at night.
breeding: We have kept these geckos at Prague Zoo since 2004, successfully breeding them repeatedly over the past ten years.
